part2.question:
Describe an application (app) you usually use on your phone or computer. You should say:
What it is
When you use it
Why you use it often
And explain how you feel about it.
part2.model_answer: To be honest, the app I utilize most is WeChat, which is Indispensable [不可或缺的] for my daily life in China. It is incredibly User-friendly [用户友好的] and allows me to do everything from chatting to paying bills. Since it puts everything At your fingertips [触手可及], I often find myself Glued to the screen [盯着屏幕看] for hours without realizing it. It is highly Efficient [高效的] for work communication too, as everyone uses it. However, it can be a bit Addictive [令人上瘾的] because there is so much content to consume. It is also very Innovative [创新的] with its mini-programs. I hope I can reduce my screen time in the future.

part2.question:
Describe a mobile app that has made your daily life easier. You should say:
What the app is
How it functions
What specific problem it solves for you
And explain why you would recommend it to others.
part2.model_answer: I want to highlight a food delivery app that is very Innovative [创新的] and helpful. It is Efficient [高效的] because it saves me a lot of time cooking after a long day at school. Although some people say these apps make us lazy, I think the convenience is Breathtaking [惊人的]. With this app, delicious food from hundreds of restaurants is always At your fingertips [触手可及]. Sometimes, I Lose track of time [忘记时间] scrolling through all the delicious options available. It prevents me from feeling Isolated [孤立的] when I eat alone. It is definitely User-friendly [用户友好的] and rarely crashes. But it can be Addictive [令人上瘾的] to order snacks.

part2.question:
Describe an app you use for learning or self-improvement. You should say:
What the app teaches
How often you use it
How effective it is
And explain why you prefer using an app over traditional methods.
part2.model_answer: I regularly use a vocabulary app that is User-friendly [用户友好的] and makes learning English fun. It prevents me from feeling bored or Isolated [孤立的] in my studies because I can compete with friends. Provided that I use it every day for ten minutes, my progress is quite fast and steady. It is Indispensable [不可或缺的] for my IELTS preparation. Unlike boring textbooks, this app keeps me engaged so I don't feel like I am studying. It is Innovative [创新的] in how it uses games to teach. It is highly Efficient [高效的] for memorizing words. I never get Addictive [令人上瘾的], but I enjoy it.

part3.question: What is the difference between how young and old people use apps?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Young people primarily use apps for social Interaction [互动] and constant daily entertainment on the go. Reason Older people tend to use them for practical reasons like reading news, messaging family, or checking the weather. Example Whereas teens are Social butterflies [交际花] online all day, seniors prioritize Privacy [隐私] and safety above all else.

part3.question: Why do some people dislike using apps?
part3.model_answer: Opinion They dislike them mainly due to serious Cybersecurity [网络安全] concerns and fear of identity theft. Reason They are afraid their personal data or money will be stolen by bad hackers if they use mobile banking. Example Unless an app guarantees 100% safety, these people refuse to join the trend of Digitalization [数字化].

part3.question: What is the most popular app in your country?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Social media apps like WeChat are definitely the most popular among everyone in my country today. Reason They allow constant Interaction [互动] between friends and provide endless entertainment throughout the day for users. Example Since these apps can cause Information overload [信息过载], people are always checking their phones for updates constantly.

part3.question: Are people becoming too dependent on mobile apps?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Yes, there is a strong Dependency [依赖] on apps in modern society for almost everything we do. Reason People cannot navigate streets or pay for food without them anymore, losing basic skills rapidly. Example Although they are helpful, technology is a Double-edged sword [双刃剑] that weakens our basic survival skills over time.

part3.question: To what extent do mobile applications compromise user privacy and data security?
part3.model_answer: Opinion I believe that apps often compromise Privacy [隐私] by collecting too much personal user data without permission. Reason Many apps track your location and spending habits to sell to advertisers for a huge profit. Example Whenever you download a "free" app, you are usually paying with your personal information unknowingly.

part3.question: Will digital tools eventually replace traditional face-to-face services entirely?
part3.model_answer: Opinion I don't think they will replace the human touch completely in essential services like medicine or care. Reason Some services, like Therapeutic [有治疗作用的] counseling or nursing, need human empathy and genuine care to work effectively. Example Even though Urbanization [城市化] promotes digital efficiency, people still crave real connection in difficult times of life.
